project.name: Photography Site
project.goal: High-contrast editorial / fashion-photography portfolio UI with bold condensed typography, oversized headlines, large imagery, and minimal UI chrome.
primary_reference_notes: High contrast palette (near-black + white) with restrained grays.
Minimal borders: thin rules and hairline underlines; lots of whitespace.
Layouts often split: text block + large image; asymmetry feels intentional.
Buttons are pill/rounded capsules; forms use underline inputs (no boxes).
Navigation is sparse and understated; content/photography is the hero.

visual_language: Editorial minimalism: the grid is strict, the type is loud, the UI is quiet.
Photography-first hierarchy: images get scale; text supports and frames.
Brutalist restraint: avoid decorative gradients/shadows; use rules and spacing.
High-contrast readability: black/white first, gray as a utility, accent sparingly.
Intentional imbalance: asymmetry is allowed when anchored to a strong grid.
do: Use big, condensed, all-caps headings and short phrases.
Keep components visually simple; rely on spacing, alignment, and type weight.
Use hairline dividers and underline inputs to maintain a magazine layout feel.
Prefer large paddings and generous negative space over boxes and borders.
dont: Don’t add skeuomorphic shadows, heavy cards, or colorful gradients.
Don’t mix many font families; keep to a display condensed + neutral sans pairing.
Don’t overuse accents; avoid bright UI colors that compete with photography.
Don’t add too many rounded corners; reserve roundness for CTAs only.

grid.notes: Use a strict grid for alignment; allow hero sections to break the container with larger imagery, but keep edges aligned to grid lines.

usage_notes: Default UI is light (white background). Use inverted (near-black) for footer / strong sections.
Use gray sparingly; it’s primarily for dividers, placeholders, and secondary text.
Avoid bright accents; if an accent is needed, use ink (black) or very muted tone.

display_condensed.preferred: A tall, condensed grotesk/industrial display face (e.g., 'Bebas Neue', 'Anton', 'Oswald', or similar).
display_condensed.fallback_stack: Impact, Haettenschweiler, 'Arial Narrow Bold', 'Segoe UI', Arial, sans-serif

text_neutral.preferred: A clean neo-grotesk for body/UI (e.g., 'Inter', 'Helvetica Neue', 'SF Pro', or similar).

mono_optional.fallback_stack: ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Liberation Mono', 'Courier New', monospace

display_1.notes: Hero headline: extremely large, condensed, minimal leading.

label_caps.notes: Used for small UI labels, section eyebrow text, and metadata.

usage_notes: Primary rhythm is 8px; section spacing uses large steps (56–96px).
Use whitespace as the main 'decoration'—avoid adding containers unless needed for readability.

borders.notes: Use hairlines for dividers and form underlines. Use strong borders sparingly (e.g., outlined buttons).

shadows.notes: Shadows should be rare; this style reads flatter and more print-like.

interaction_notes: Hover states are subtle: underline reveals, opacity shifts, 2–4px translate, or image scale 1.02.
Avoid bouncy/springy motion; keep it editorial and controlled.

philosophy: Large, crisp images with minimal overlays.
Prefer edge-to-edge crops in hero and gallery; keep captions small and aligned.

iconography.style: Simple, geometric, single-weight icons. Social icons can be inside small circular containers.

rules: Short headlines; avoid long marketing paragraphs.
Prefer uppercase for primary statements and section titles.
Use verbs and outcomes: 'Let’s talk', 'Send message', 'Complete service'.

hero_split.intent: A bold editorial headline block paired with a dominant image on the right.

layout.desktop: Two columns: left (text/form) ~55%, right (image) ~45% with generous internal padding.
layout.mobile: Stacked: image first or last; headline remains oversized but wraps.

editorial_section.intent: Sparse section with a large headline and a short supporting paragraph or list.
rules: Use a single dominant typographic element per section (headline OR list).
Align to grid edges; use hairline rules to separate sections.

gallery_grid.intent: Portfolio collection layout with numbered items and minimal captions.
layout_rules: Use consistent gutters; allow mixed image sizes but keep baseline alignment for captions.
Numbering (01/02/03) is small and light; name/title is bolder; date is muted.
gallery_grid.hover: Image scales subtly; caption underline reveals; keep interaction minimal.

inverted_footer.intent: Strong black footer with minimal navigation, contact blocks, language selector, and social icons.
layout_rules: Use generous vertical padding; keep text light (white/gray) and aligned in columns.
Logo/brand can be stacked, large, and left-aligned.

AppShell.description: Overall page scaffold: background, container widths, consistent section spacing, and grid alignment.

Header.description: Minimal top navigation with small links; brand is present but not overly decorative.

layout.alignment: Brand left; nav centered/right; keep breathing room above hero.

interaction.link_hover: Underline or subtle opacity; no heavy backgrounds.

Hero.description: Large editorial headline plus supporting kicker/copy and optional CTA; can be split with imagery.

image.edge_alignment: Align image edges to grid lines; allow larger-than-container feel on desktop if desired.

SectionHeading.description: Large section title, often oversized, uppercase, condensed.

Paragraph.description: Body copy used sparingly; keep columns narrow for readability.

Divider.description: Hairline rule used to separate editorial blocks and form rows.

Button.description: Primary CTA is a dark pill button with white text; secondary may be outlined.

TextLink.description: Inline or standalone text link; uses underline on hover; often paired with a small arrow.

Form.description: Contact forms are minimalist: underline inputs, large spacing, few labels, clear placeholders.

validation.tone: Minimal, not loud. Use small text; avoid colored boxes.

FieldLabel.description: Optional; the design often relies on placeholder/aria-label. If used, keep small and uppercase.

TextInput.description: Single-line input with underline style; no box border; flush to grid.

requirements: Visible focus indicator (underline thickens + optional ring).
Use proper label or aria-label; placeholder alone is not a label.

Textarea.description: Multi-line input matching TextInput underline style; generous height.

Select.description: Underline select; avoid heavy dropdown styling.

Checkbox.description: Minimal checkbox; rarely used in this aesthetic.

Switch.description: If needed (e.g., theme toggle), keep flat and monochrome.

Card.description: Use sparingly; prefer flat layouts. When used, cards are borderless or hairline-bordered.

ImageCard.description: Portfolio item: image + number + name + date/metadata.

layout.caption_alignment: Left aligned; keep tight vertical spacing under image.

interaction.hover: Image scales 1.02; caption underline reveals; cursor pointer.

GalleryGrid.description: Grid of portfolio items; can mix sizes but maintain consistent gutters.

Carousel.description: Minimal arrow navigation; no heavy pagination dots unless absolutely needed.

Badge.description: Minimal label/tag, uppercase, small; often border-only.

List.description: For services/features: use large bold headings with tiny supporting copy, arranged in columns.

Table.description: If used, keep it editorial: hairline rules, no zebra stripes, left aligned.

Modal.description: Minimal modal with strong typography; no heavy rounding or shadows.

Drawer.description: For mobile navigation or filters; keep monochrome and typographic.

Toast.description: Small, restrained notifications; avoid bright colors.

Tooltip.description: Simple tooltip; short text; high contrast.

Pagination.description: Minimal arrows and small labels; aligns with gallery/collection navigation.

Breadcrumb.description: Small uppercase breadcrumb; use muted gray and separators.

LanguageSwitcher.description: Footer language list: simple text links, spaced evenly; active language is brighter.

SocialIconButton.description: Circular icon buttons, often stacked vertically; monochrome.

Tabs.description: Minimal tabs (rare). Use uppercase labels; no pill backgrounds; rely on underline + weight.

Accordion.description: Editorial accordion: full-width rows separated by hairlines; large question/title, small supporting content.

interaction.open_close: Fast, controlled height transition; no bounce.

Lightbox.description: Full-screen image viewer for portfolio. Keep UI minimal and let the photo dominate.

requirements: Trap focus while open; restore focus on close.

VideoEmbed.description: If video is used (reels/behind-the-scenes), keep player chrome minimal and monochrome.

style.controls: Native controls preferred; avoid custom colorful skins.
style.caption: body_small

StatBlock.description: Small metric + label (e.g., years, shoots). Use strong type and lots of spacing; no boxes.

Loader.description: Minimal loading indicator: thin spinner or simple linear progress; monochrome only.

Skeleton.description: Subtle skeletons for images and text: muted gray blocks, no shimmer or very subtle shimmer.

EmptyState.description: Editorial empty state: a strong headline + short guidance + a single CTA.

ErrorState.description: Minimal error state: calm message, recovery action, and optional error code in small muted text.

Footer.description: Inverted, spacious, multi-column footer with brand block, contact, location, language, and copyright.

style.dividers: rare; use spacing more than rules

AccessibilityGuidelines.description: Guardrails to keep the minimal style usable.
rules: Minimum contrast ratio for body text: 4.5:1 (prefer higher).
Interactive hit targets: at least 44x44px for touch.
Always provide a visible focus state (underline thickening is OK but must be obvious).
Don’t rely on placeholder text as the only label; use labels or aria-label.
Avoid text overlay on busy photos unless there is a solid/blurred scrim.
